org.jcatapult.mvc.message
Class DefaultMessageStore

java.lang.Object
  org.jcatapult.mvc.message.DefaultMessageStore
All Implemented Interfaces:
MessageStore
public class DefaultMessageStore
extends Object
implements MessageStore

This is the default message workflow implementation. It removes all flash messages from the session and places them in the request.

Author:
Brian Pontarelli

Method Detail

addConversionError

public void addConversionError(String field,
                               String bundle,
                               Map<String,String> dynamicAttributes,
                               Object... values)
                        throws org.jcatapult.l10n.MissingMessageException
Usually called by the ParameterWorkflow, this method adds a conversion error for the given parameter. The values can be token replaced within the localized error message.

Specified by:
addConversionError in interface MessageStore
Parameters:
field - The name of the field that the conversion error failed for.
bundle - The name of the bundle that the error is pulled from.
dynamicAttributes - The dynamic attributes, which might be useful for error messaging stuff.
values - The values attempting to be set into the field.
Throws:
org.jcatapult.l10n.MissingMessageException - If the conversion message is missing.

addFieldMessage

public void addFieldMessage(MessageScope scope,
                            String field,
                            String bundle,
                            String key,
                            Object... values)
                     throws org.jcatapult.l10n.MissingMessageException
Adds a field message which is pulled from the MessageProvider.

Specified by:
addFieldMessage in interface MessageStore
Parameters:
scope - The scope that the message should be placed into.
field - The field that the message is associated with.
bundle - The bundle the message should be pulled from.
key - The key in the bundle.
values - The values used to format the message.
Throws:
org.jcatapult.l10n.MissingMessageException - If the message is missing.

addFieldMessage

public void addFieldMessage(MessageScope scope,
                            String field,
                            String key,
                            Object... values)
                     throws org.jcatapult.l10n.MissingMessageException
Adds a field message which is pulled from the MessageProvider. The name of the bundle is the same as the class name of the current action that the request is associated with. If there is no action, this method will throw an exception.

Specified by:
addFieldMessage in interface MessageStore
Parameters:
scope - The scope that the message should be placed into.
field - The field that the message is associated with.
key - The key in the bundle.
values - The values used to format the message.
Throws:
org.jcatapult.l10n.MissingMessageException - If the message is missing.

public boolean contains(MessageType type)

Specified by:
contains in interface MessageStore
Parameters:
